review:
Over the years I frequently get asked what the best Bluetooth sports headphone
is. My stock answer is that none are perfect, all have their drawbacks, and
the handful of top models may fit you well and work great -- or they may not.  
  
Bose's SoundSport Wireless, the company's first Bluetooth sports headphone,
isn't perfect either, but it may just be the best Bluetooth sports headphone
currently out there.  
  
I mean you don't jam the earbud into your ear and completely seal off your ear
canal (that type of headphone is referred to as a "noise-isolating" in-ear
headphone). Thanks to Bose's eartips, which come in three sizes -- small,
medium, large -- the bud sits loosely in your ear yet remains securely in
place.  
  
The SoundSport Wireless comes with three sizes of ear tips.  
  
This model is equipped with a special sport version of the tips that's
different from the tips included with Bose's earlier in-ear headphones, so
they aren't interchangeable. I should also point out that because the
earpieces extend out from your ears you'll probably have some trouble wearing
these under certain helmets.  
  
The ear pieces are somewhat bulky, but not so bulky to feel heavy on your
ears. However, if there's a criticism of this headphone's design, it's that
the ear pieces could protrude out a little less and be more discrete-looking.
Easier said then done, of course -- today's battery technology is holding back
miniaturization efforts.  
  
Rival headphones -- such as Jaybird's X2 and Freedom, Beats' Powerbeats 2
Wireless and Monster's Adidas Sport Adistar -- give you the ability to shorten
the cord length (or cinch up the cord) for those who want to wear the cord
closer to the neck. With this headphone, you can't adjust the cord length, but
what Bose has done is provide a clip you can hook on to the back of your shirt
(at the top) to keep the cord from flopping about. It's a smart design and I
thought it worked well; the cord remained fairly stable, even while I was
running.  
  
The only downside to the floating-fit, open design is that ambient sound does
leak in: this isn't a great headphone for noisy environments. (If that's your
preference, Bose's upcoming QuietControl 30 is a wireless model that features
active noise-canceling.) But if you're out running or biking, you'll be able
to hear cars coming, which is why a lot of runners and bikers prefer their
headphones to have open designs.  
  
As you might expect, the headphone is sweat- and water-resistant and there's
an inline mic and remote that lets you skip songs, adjust volume, and take and
make calls. Bose is touting its quality as a headset for making calls, as well
as how reliable the Bluetooth connection is. I can attest to experiencing only
minimal Bluetooth hiccups and was satisfied with how it performed as a
headset, though the QuietControl 30 and QuietComfort 35 offer superior headset
performance. Those models have noise-reduction features that muffle ambient
sound, including wind and street noise.  
  
Just as importantly I had no trouble pairing and repairing the headphone with
my iPhone 6S and Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge (the Bose features near-field
communication tap-to-pair technology for devices like the Samsung that support
this feature). I also simultaneously paired it with my iPhone 6S and MacBook
Air and had no trouble switching between the two when a call came in as I was
watching a video on the computer.  
  
Bose Connect, a free app for Android and iOS, allows you to manage your
pairing list, upgrade the firmware and change the auto power off settings (the
headphone powers down if you don't use it for a certain length of time, which
is a good battery-saving feature). When you turn on the headphones, a female
voice alerts you how much battery life is remaining and with which devices
you're paired. That information is also available in the app.  
  
Battery life for the SoundSport is rated at 6 hours, which is fairly decent
for this type of small headphone (though not great overall), and 5 hours for
the SoundSport Pulse. Both SoundSport wireless headphones come with a simple
neoprene carrying case, but Bose will also sell an accessory case that has a
built-in battery for on-the-go charging that'll cost $50. That battery case
provides three full charges, or up to 18 hours of battery life.  
  
Bose will sell a separate accessory case that has a built-in rechargeable
battery for 3000 rupees.  
  
I used the the SoundSport Wireless for over a week, taking it to the gym,
using it on the streets of Mumbai and doing two runs with it on Lodha Palava.
I used the large eartips and was able to get a comfortable, secure fit.  
  
With a lot of in-ear sports headphones, I find myself having to make little
adjustments to relieve some discomfort or get a more secure fit, especially
while running, but with this headphone the adjustments I had to make were
minimal. They were easy to put on and take off, they powered on and paired
quickly to my phone, and worked as well as any Bluetooth headphone I've used.  
  
The sound quality is very good for an in-ear sports Bluetooth headphone.
There've been some complaints about it not playing loud enough, but I didn't
have that issue with the iPhone 6S or Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge I tested it with.
(Bluetooth performance on computers tends to be a little dodgy and perhaps
some of the volume complaints are related to computer connectivity.)  
  
The headphone doesn't sound as good as Bose's SoundTrue Ultra wired
headphones, which I like a lot and offers cleaner, more dynamic sound, with
better defined bass. But that's the nature of Bluetooth. You lose a little
something. In the case of the SoundSport Wireless, the loss isn't huge.
There's some clarity missing (the highs are a little recessed), but you get
lots of bass and the midrange sounds pretty natural and warm. It's also a
fairly open-sounding headphone.  
  
What's interesting about the sound is that this headphone seems to be
optimized for outside use. Inside, in a quiet room, the bass can sound a
little bloated, which gives everything a slightly dull edge. But when you're
walking around outside, the bass sounds toned down because it's competing with
ambient noise, whether it's the wind or traffic or whatever. If you didn't
have that extra bass the headphone would sound thin outside. The way it's
tuned, it sounds smoother and better balanced outdoors.  
  
I didn't think it sounded better than the Jaybird Freedom, which also delivers
excellent sound for an in-ear Bluetooth headphone -- though that model costs
33 percent more. But it bests the Beats PowerBeats 2 Wireless, Plantronics'
BackBeat Fit and Monster's Adidas Sport Adistar. The latter two models cost
less than the Bose.  
  
All that said, what ultimately makes the Bose the superior headphone and easy
to recommend is its fit and comfort level. No, it's not perfect -- and it
won't be a perfect fit for everyone -- but it's one of the few "premium" in-
ear Bluetooth headphones that I think will work for the vast majority who buy
it.  
  
The SoundSport Wireless' highlights:  
  
Available in two colors at launch (black, aqua). Choose your pick!  
Price: 13k  
6 hours of battery life  
Water- and sweat-resistant  
Auto-power off feature  
Accessory charging case costs around 3000 extra  
Works with Bose's free Connect app for Android and iOS devices  
NFC tap-to-pair technology for devices that supports it.  
  
Note:  
SoundSport Pulse Wireless with built-in heart-rate monitor that comes in red
and has 5 hours of battery life  
  
Good: The SoundSoundSport Wireless is a very comfortable in-ear wireless
Bluetooth sports headphone that's sweat-resistant and sounds great. The
earphones fit securely in your ears thanks to winged tips. The headphone works
decently as a headset for making cell-phone calls and has an auto-off feature
to preserve battery life.  
  
Bad: The ear pieces protrude noticeably from your ears (they're a little bulky
that don't feel heavy); battery life tops out at 6 hours.  
  
Crux: The Bose SoundSport Wireless is the most comfortable, best overall in-
ear Bluetooth sports headphone you can buy right now.

I am using this headphone for last couple of days. Please find my review below  
  
1\. Packaging - the packaging is top class. Like BOSE. But, it’s a bit big in
comparison to the product size. However, they have given the extra buds to fit
your ears and also a small pouch, which is very nice and has a hook which you
can loop it to your trouser hook or to your bag etc. It also includes a
charging cable but no charging plug  
  
2\. The look and feel - It has a anti tangle cable which is good. The colour I
have is black, so it looks pretty run of the mill and dull. The headphone has
a clip which you can remove and replace depending on where you want to clip
it. The earphones are large in comparison to the ones you get in the market.
When you put it inside your ear, the outer part (where BOSE is written)
protrudes and make look a bit odd by no big deal. The material is rubbery and
on the right part of the earbud, you have the power switch as well as the
charging micro USB port. On the left bud, there is nothing. the cable has a
mic as well as volume up/down button. Which is bit unusual and rubbery. But it
works well, just that, you need to press it hard to make it work. But, you
tend to get used to it. Its not one of those soft touch ones.  
  
3\. The pairing and BOSE app - There is a BOSE app (I downloaded the iOS app).
The BOSE connect app shows you the battery percentage and you can also control
the volume from the app. It also has features like product help, feedback,
policy/settings and a link to connect to bose.com. It also gives you the
option to activate or deactivate the voice prompt option and prompt language.
It also enables you to share music between 2 BOSE headphones (Bluetooth ones I
guess, since I haven't tried). It pairs well and fast. You can also get
multiple devices paired at one time.  
  
4\. The music quality - I have tried few Bluetooth headsets before, including
noise cancelling bose wired headset. I must say, the quality is very good, if
not excellent. The bass is superb and it tells you, you are listening to a
high end device.  
  
5\. Battery - The battery is just OK. From the time, I paired the headphone
till the time I got the low battery alert, it took me approx. 9 hours. And I
would have used the headphone for approx. 2 hours of talk time paired to my
phone. Haven't tried with music only listening time, but, I guess it will be
more at a stretch.  
  
6\. Ease of use while walking / running - The earbuds fits quite well and you
have choice of size, which comes part of the package. While walking, it just
stays in the ear with no fear of falling off. If you clipped it to the back of
your collar (which while walking isn't needed), its better, but without it
also, it’s pretty firm to both your ears. While running, you may clip it or
without. I did a 2kms run with the Bluetooth earphone plugged in and I would
say, almost all the time, I felt it to be in place with once or twice pushing
it back in more from the perspective of being sure as the earbuds showed no
indication of falling off due to running. So, a thumbs up here. If you are
able to clip it well, then it will stay in place even better while running.
Just that, if you clip it to the back of your collar, the shirt tends to get
pulled as you run, and it may make you feel as if the earbuds are getting
lose. So, get the clipping right, and you may not have issues. It's water
resistant but to what extent I wouldn't know since didn't test it.  
  
7\. Final Verdict - Bose is expensive. So, you can get a shade lower quality
output by paying less than half. But, then BOSE is also about brand and also
for those, you are very particular about finest quality audio (which may not a
big deal for music while you are walking or running). Overall, if you can
spend for a BOSE, go for it, but if you are ready for a slight compromise, you
may remain happy for an earphone half the price.

I’ve been using Bose products for a while and I’ve always awed at their
quality - both in terms of build quality and sound.  
Same is the case with Bose Soundsport Wireless! They deliver punchy sound
notes along with good base. You won’t find better bluetooth in-ear earphones
at this price range. They may look bulky, but they sit comfortably in your
ears with the Stay Hear+ tips and never fall off while working out. They don’t
cancel out the ambient noise, but that’s a plus point while running / jogging
in the roads, making a person aware of the surroundings. It can connect to two
devices simultaneously, thus, you can jump from one device to another
effortlessly!  
  
Overall, a good buy and a value for money! You might want to look into Jaybird
X3’s too to make an informed choice.

These are the most comfortable bluetooth earphones.  
Once worn we totally forget its physical presence and sound just images in
front of us. The sound quality is one of the best out of many blueetooth
earphones i have heard so far. when it comes to comfort, its the bose
(universal opinion and i do amend). Though sony (nwz-s615) is cheaper, having
an option at home, I always pick this bose against the sony everyday to use.
It would have been more comfortable if the earphones were as thin as the bose
1st gen in-ears, which i could wear at night, sleep and roll with it and wake
up next day to find it in my ears (not falling) only after the wires pull
(meaning you dont know its sitting in your ears, its that much comfortable).
Since the bose blueetooth ear buds are bulky, they protrude and hinder when
you roll over.  
Apart from that these are one of the best choice. I already have the bose 1st
in-ears which still my 1st choice over the many many renounced earphones i
have and the customer service that i experiences when its (1st gen bose in-
ear)wire were almost broke(though working) did a very good job of exchanging
with new one's for 2000rs(may be the cost of re-wiring)  
So absolutely the best choice, but the pricing should be half of what they ask
for...

I have been using BOSE products from past 7 years and this is my recent
purchase. As a music lover, I tried couple of other brands and I have to say
this. I personally think Apple ear set does similar job as this product does
in terms of quality of sound. The only difference lies in the minor musical
sounds which you can pick in BOSE but not in other ear set. To this small
advantage, I think it is priced very high.  
  
I requested to return the product as headset never stayed on and was popping
out as I was jogging. Highly disappointed with this.

The product is good but not as per my requirements:  
Pros:  
1\. Sound quality is good, which is obvious, it's BOSE  
2\. Even though they looks big but when you'll wear them they are very light.  
3\. Pretty good for gym.  
  
Cons:  
  
1\. You can not use them for cycling and motorcycle, due to it's big size  
2\. As i mentioned mentioned "cycling" above because there's too much wind
noise coming when you are riding a cycle or a motorcycle.  
3\. they do not cancel outside noise, you will still be able to hear people
around you, it can be considered good or bad to some, but for me, i did't
really liked it, as at gym you will be able to hear other noise too except the
music.  
  
Over all it's good, they are meant for gym but if you are looking for
something to use during biking or motorcycle multipurpose, it should not be
your choice!

review:
The product box was already broken inside the packing. As the product is I
ordered it and got and intex headphone inside

Excellent product by bose .....

Battery life- 8/10  
Finish- 8/10  
Sound - 9/10  
  
I took one star and one point for the fact it does not completely seal ear so
there is lot of sound leak and you will not appreciate music outside. Bass
lacks punch. Mid and tremble is clear

I placed the order on the 10th and received the product on the 11th with a
perfect packaging, hats off to the amazon delivery service... Now coming to
the product, it’s a Bose and what else can u expect other than quality. The
headphones I bought was black. I immediately hooked to my iPhone and yes the
sound quality was mind blowing and crystal clear. But when u compare with the
Bose wired earphones or the wireless QC overhead or the B&O headphones the
bass seems to be a lil off the line but not a strong point to complain and can
be brushed off as a minor glitch. I bought it for 12k approx and my verdict is
it’s worth every penny.  
The pros:  
Easy pairing  
Great sound quality  
Stylish looks  
Built quality  
The cons:  
Actually none but for namesake “low bass”  
  
Hope it helps... great work Amazon and Bose

Amazing Product! Worth spending. Bose is the best. Sound clarity is amazing.
Very good punchy bass.

Bose earphones/headpones are known for their clean sound signature.  
These are good earphones with outstanding connectivity and ease of use.  
A few things that i liked:-  
\- Bluetooth 4.1 gives you the freedom to connect upto two devices at the same
time. The bose connect app is a plus as it opens up ways to alter/adjust and
update your earphones. The app is userfriendly and interactive.  
-These aren't for bass lover's, however they give you an accurate sound with decent amount of bass for that workout pump.  
\- Probably by far the most confortable wirless earphones. Sometimes you don't
even realise they are there.  
  
Things i didn't like:-  
\- The battery life is about 6 hours. When you spend this kind of money, you
do expect a little more for your buck. Other wirleless earphones in this price
range are offering more for the same amount.  
\- The charging case would have been an awesome addition if given with these,
but unfortunately they cose another 3200/-

First things first, Amazon delivered this product well on-time and when this
was not available anywhere else in India. This is the most precious and
practical possession in my Bose portfolio.  
This was the first wireless earphone category offering by Bose and when not
available in stores last few months, the rumours were they are going to
redesign. But the actual reason when I see the same product back on shelves is
the extreme demand which made the supply a big constraint.  
  
Pros :  
\- Extremely user friendly be it the way we can hang in ears, to pairing.  
\- Sweat and Tangle Free. Wearing this on the go is a swift and stays the same
even after an intense 2 hour workout.  
\- Battery life - atleast 10 hours of continuous play. Comes atleast couple of
days when used moderately.  
\- Last but not the least, Bose mark sound quality.  
\- The clip in the back is very thoughtful and functional.  
Cons :  
\- The voice over help interrupts an active call by announcing the full
sentence and name of the caller. Though this option can be disabled.  
\- Yes, it is little bulky in looks on ears, but it never falls off very
easily.  
\- Can pair only 2 devices at once.

I wanted to buy headphone that can connect with two devices simultaneously. It
should connect to my phone for playing music etc & should also connect to my
windows 7 laptop for skype meetings. This headphone does it with out any break
at all.  
  
Now i can freely listen my music and whenever there is a skype call it will
automatically ask you to pick up skype call. once call is done it starts
playing my music back.  
  
Connectivity is smooth. works very well and connects easily. battery life is
ok but its very new for me to comment of that. charging time is also under 2
hours. which is great.  
  
I only found one issue that it doesnt have noise cancellation. so you cant
have calls in very noisy environment as it picks up all the sounds around you.
but if you are taking calls from office & home (less noise ofcours). than you
will not find any issues.  
  
packaging was good and delivered on time as promised by amazon.

I became a headphone/earphone user due to my work and extensive travels. I
experimented with a various brands - Sony, Phillips, Audio Technica,
Sennheiser and Bose. I quickly realised that the in-ear earphones suited my
purpose the best. So I gave up all my over-ear headphones, including my Bose
SoundTrue.  
  
For a very long time I relied on the Sennheiser CX 180 Street II In-Ear
Headphone (Black) and then moved to the Sennheiser CX 275 S In -Ear Universal
Mobile Headphone With Mic (Black) - both i loved very much, great quality.  
  
After some deliberation i decided to move on to a wireless headphones and was
torn between the Bose and the Jaybird but finally chose the Bose.  
  
I have been using the SoundSport for the past couple of months now and its
simply sublime.  
  
Sound Quality, Balance of treble and base, Comfort, Fit and Looks - it scores
a 5/5 in every aspect.  
  
It connects without any hassle to all my Apple products and is a perfect match
for the sound quality that iTunes Music is capable to deliver.  
  
If you are wearing this while working, you will forget that you are wearing
something in your ear - total immersion!  
  
The only regret is that the battery could have been better, it says 6 hours
but it gives between 4-5 hours.

This is really good. Sound quality is awesome and the bass is adequate. In
fact I like the bass better on this than my QC25 Noise cancelling
headphones.Fits nicely in the ear and does not fall off during jogging or
sprinting. Guess what, this is so good that its the second time I have
purchased this as I had lost my previous ones on a flight.

title: SATISFIED
If you are looking for Bluetooth earphones this is worth a try!!!
Large but comfortable
Not recommended, not worth the price
Range of bluetooth signal is also very good. On same floor i can keep my mobile ...
Simple solution for the glitch in Bose soundsport( not in all devices but majorly in Android devices)
A BaNg for a bUcK :)
Disappointed with the experience
Best wireless sports headphones.
Thank god I'm not insane enough to buy such over-priced non-sense!
review:
One of the best products I have ever used. I am very well satisfied with the
bose product. But not pleased with the cover of the charging port in mere
future it will come out. So to that bose has to make a change in the upcoming
models

The ones i got from amazon went rogue within 15 days. The headphones
discharged within 30 mins after changing for almost 2.5hrs. I reached out to
bose CustomerCare and they were kind enough to replace it for me.  
It is excellent and the sound quality is great. You can connect upto 2 devices
and the mobile app works like a charm. The design of the ear buds are
brilliant and they give you 3 pairs of ear buds(3 different sizes) to suit
your ear type. The volume control buttons are little hard but really does not
matter. The battery comes to almost 5hrs (4hrs continues usage) for staggered
usage.

Good but not the best by Bose  
Overall good if you are really serious about your workouts.

Not sure of the kind of benchmark people who are posting good reviews about
this product have but these are far below quality than the standard iPhone 7
earphones. The sound quality is absolutely lo was grade and the fit ain’t
proper either, have tried all the 3 ear tips and they keep falling. Hugely
disappointed for this price point, I’d recommend do not put your money in this
if you are hoping that Bose experience will be awesome.

I primarily wanted to use this headset for workout in GYM, both during cardio
and weight training. I can now confirm it works perfectly in both conditions.
The huge size of earpiece is not an issue at all, during running or working
out. Range of bluetooth signal is also very good.  
  
On same floor i can keep my mobile 15 feet away and still no drop of any
signal, so it serves my purpose as why i bought this headset. Sound is also
very good and no complains on that front as well.  
  
It was good that after spending time on choosing between Jaybird X3 and this I
went with bose.

This is by far the best Bluetooth Bluetooth headphone that I have ever used.
The sound clarity is excellent. It does have a problem connecting to a few
Android devices but otherwise works fine...I've read complaints that many
devices are not supporting the latest firmware but that can be undone in a
simple degrade of the device firmware. I myself facestthis problem and was
recommended to go to brush.bose.com after connecting my device to the
computer. When in the website after installing a small document required the
webpage will direct you to the firmware part of your device ( the headphone
must be connected via USB to the PC) where you have the option of degrading
the firmware. To degrade the firmware one has to press A D V (up arrow) ( down
arrow ) specifically in that order to degrade. Once able to degrade it is
recommended to degrade it 2 versions for the best results. After I did this my
device worked flawlessly.

Its a bose. The sound quality is good. U can get that in most of the
headphones and at much lower cost. BUT and there is a big "BUT".. these are
well built too.  
Ergonomics are good, the fit is good, takes a while to get use to though.
Definitely recommend it. You get what you pay for.

I recd the item before scheduled time. But on opening the package found that
the left ear piece was not functioning, also the sound quality is not what I
was expecting from a Bose product. The fit of the ear piece is also not good.
I have initiated a replacement request, hopefully it will be resolved.

A product par excellence. Sits comfortably in your ear canals for long without
any discomfort at all. It just sits there no matter what you do. I usually use
it in the gym everyday and during my runs and they never come off. In the
sound department they are great too. Crisp with the right nuances of bass and
treble, although I wish it was a little louder or maybe that is something to
do with my Samsung phone. I also bought the charging case with this which is
such a thoughtful product. It's literally a life saver because this pair last
for about 6 hours and I usually forget to charge them every other day but I
just keep it on charge in the case everyday after Im done using it.

Rs.13,275.00 for a bluetooth headphone which doesn't even have noise
cancellation or IPX water-proofing...? Thank god I'm not insane enough to buy
such over-priced non-sense!
